anip.mediancut
Class MedianCut

java.lang.Object
  anip.mediancut.MedianCut
Direct Known Subclasses:
ArrayMedianCut, ListMedianCut
public abstract class MedianCut
extends java.lang.Object

Represents functionality for creating an optimized, indexed color palette from a source image by well-known median cut method.

Author:
Artturi Tilanterä

Method Detail

createPalette

public abstract void createPalette(Bitmap image,
                                   short[] palette,
                                   int maxColors)
Creates an indexed palette for a 24-bit source image. Uses median cut color quantization.

Parameters:
image - source image.
palette - color palette, data order RGB RGB RGB ...
maxColors - maximum number of colors in the palette.

createPalette

public void createPalette(Bitmap image,
                          short[] palette,
                          int maxColors,
                          int minR,
                          int minG,
                          int minB,
                          int maxR,
                          int maxG,
                          int maxB,
                          ColorCuboid prototype)
Creates an indexed palette for a 24-bit source image. Uses median cut color quantization. Parameters minR .. maxB are initial values, each of them between 0..255 and of course the minimum values being less than the maximum ones. These initial values speed up the palette creation process if they are known. Otherwise one may want to use the createPalette(Bitmap image, short[] palette, shortMaxColors) version of the image, which calls this method with parameters minR = minG = minB = 0 and maxR = maxG = maxB = 255.

Parameters:
image - source image.
palette - color palette, data order RGB RGB RGB ...
maxColors - maximum number of colors in the palette.
minR - minimum value of red component in the source image.
minG - minimum value of green component in the source image.
minB - minimum value of blue component in the source image.
maxR - maximum value of red component in the source image.
maxG - maximum value of green component in the source image.
maxB - maximum value of blue component in the source image.
